lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio, unable so far to win an extension of his control over the schools from the Republican-controlled State Senate, reached for a default political strategy.

headline.print_headline: Seeking High Ground, de Blasio Skips Hearing on Control of City Schools
headline.main: De Blasio, Seeking High Ground, Skips Hearing on Control of New York’s Schools

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio, unable so far to win an extension of his control over the schools from the Republican-controlled State Senate, reached for a default political strategy.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio opts out of hearing on his attempt to seek 7-year extension on his control of city's schools after suggesting that he is being treated unfairly by Republican-controlled State Senate; opponents speaking at hearing in his absence chastise de Blasio, saying he should put aside his ego on issue concerning welfare of children.
